trans-unit.source: App management

trans-unit.source: Hidden and shown apps for iOS 9.3
trans-unit.target: Hidden and shown apps for iOS 9.3

trans-unit.source: For supervised devices running iOS 9.3 or later, you can use the hidden and shown apps list in the iOS general configuration policy to:
trans-unit.target: For supervised devices running iOS 9.3 or later, you can use the hidden and shown apps list in the iOS general configuration policy to:

trans-unit.source: Specify a list of apps that will be hidden from users.
trans-unit.target: Specify a list of apps that will be hidden from users.

trans-unit.source: Users cannot view, or launch these apps.
trans-unit.target: Users cannot view, or launch these apps.

trans-unit.source: Specify a list of apps that users can view and launch.
trans-unit.target: Specify a list of apps that users can view and launch.

trans-unit.source: No other apps can be viewed or launched.
trans-unit.target: No other apps can be viewed or launched.

trans-unit.source: The apps you can specify include both apps you have deployed, and the built-in iOS apps like Messages and Notes.
trans-unit.target: The apps you can specify include both apps you have deployed, and the built-in iOS apps like Messages and Notes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [iOS policy settings in Microsoft Intune]( https://docs.microsoft.com/intune/deploy-use/ios-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune)
trans-unit.target: For details, see [iOS policy settings in Microsoft Intune]( https://docs.microsoft.com/intune/deploy-use/ios-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune)

trans-unit.source: Allowed and blocked apps policy for Samsung KNOX devices
trans-unit.target: Allowed and blocked apps policy for Samsung KNOX devices

trans-unit.source: You can now configure a custom policy for Samsung KNOX devices that lets you create one of the following:
trans-unit.target: You can now configure a custom policy for Samsung KNOX devices that lets you create one of the following:

trans-unit.source: A list of apps that are blocked from running on the device.
trans-unit.target: A list of apps that are blocked from running on the device.

trans-unit.source: Even if installed, an app defined in the blocked list cannot be activated on the device.
trans-unit.target: Even if installed, an app defined in the blocked list cannot be activated on the device.

trans-unit.source: A list of apps that users of the device are allowed to install from the Google Play store.
trans-unit.target: A list of apps that users of the device are allowed to install from the Google Play store.

trans-unit.source: No other apps can be installed from the store.
trans-unit.target: No other apps can be installed from the store.

trans-unit.source: These settings can only be used by devices that run Samsung KNOX.
trans-unit.target: These settings can only be used by devices that run Samsung KNOX.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Use custom policies to allow and block apps for Samsung KNOX devices]( custom-policy-to-allow-and-block-samsung-knox-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Use custom policies to allow and block apps for Samsung KNOX devices]( custom-policy-to-allow-and-block-samsung-knox-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: New apps compatible with mobile application management (MAM) policies
trans-unit.target: New apps compatible with mobile application management (MAM) policies

trans-unit.source: The Yammer app for [iOS](https://itunes.apple.com/app/yammer/id289559439?mt=8) and [Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.yammer.v1) is now compatible with [Intune mobile application management (MAM) policies](/intune/deploy-use/protect-app-data-using-mobile-app-management-policies-with-microsoft-intune), whether or not the device is enrolled.
trans-unit.target: The Yammer app for [iOS](https://itunes.apple.com/app/yammer/id289559439?mt=8) and [Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.yammer.v1) is now compatible with [Intune mobile application management (MAM) policies](/intune/deploy-use/protect-app-data-using-mobile-app-management-policies-with-microsoft-intune), whether or not the device is enrolled.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of MAM compatible apps, see the [Microsoft Intune application partners](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/cloud-platform/microsoft-intune-partners) site.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of MAM compatible apps, see the [Microsoft Intune application partners](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/cloud-platform/microsoft-intune-partners) site.

trans-unit.source: Intune Viewer apps
trans-unit.target: Intune Viewer apps

trans-unit.source: With the release of the new RMS sharing app, we are removing the following Intune Viewer apps, beginning in August, 2016:
trans-unit.target: With the release of the new RMS sharing app, we are removing the following Intune Viewer apps, beginning in August, 2016:

trans-unit.source: Intune AV Viewer
trans-unit.target: Intune AV Viewer

trans-unit.source: Intune PDF Viewer
trans-unit.target: Intune PDF Viewer

trans-unit.source: Intune Image Viewer for Android from Google Play
trans-unit.target: Intune Image Viewer for Android from Google Play

trans-unit.source: Instead of using the Intune Viewer apps, we recommend using the new [Rights Management app (RMS sharing) for Android](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/deploy-use/end-user-experience-for-mam-enabled-apps-with-microsoft-intune#viewing-media-files-with-the-rights-management-sharing-app), which allows you to deploy one app instead of three separate apps to securely view corporate files on Android devices.
trans-unit.target: Instead of using the Intune Viewer apps, we recommend using the new [Rights Management app (RMS sharing) for Android](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/deploy-use/end-user-experience-for-mam-enabled-apps-with-microsoft-intune#viewing-media-files-with-the-rights-management-sharing-app), which allows you to deploy one app instead of three separate apps to securely view corporate files on Android devices.

trans-unit.source: When the Intune viewer app is no longer supported, it will be removed from the Google Store and will not be available for future use.
trans-unit.target: When the Intune viewer app is no longer supported, it will be removed from the Google Store and will not be available for future use.

trans-unit.target: Android 7.0 support

trans-unit.source: Google removal of remote passcode reset capability on Android 7.0 devices
trans-unit.target: Google removal of remote passcode reset capability on Android 7.0 devices

trans-unit.source: Google is removing the ability of IT administrators and end users to remotely reset the passcode of Android 7.0 devices.
trans-unit.target: Google is removing the ability of IT administrators and end users to remotely reset the passcode of Android 7.0 devices.

trans-unit.source: Previously, IT administrators could remotely reset a user’s passcode, and end users could reset their passcodes from the Company Portal website.
trans-unit.target: Previously, IT administrators could remotely reset a user’s passcode, and end users could reset their passcodes from the Company Portal website.

trans-unit.target: Minimum iOS Managed Browser version updated to 8.0

trans-unit.target: What's coming

trans-unit.source: iOS 10 support
trans-unit.target: iOS 10 support

trans-unit.source: Intune will fully support iOS 10.
trans-unit.target: Intune will fully support iOS 10.

trans-unit.source: More information will follow the iOS 10 public release.
trans-unit.target: More information will follow the iOS 10 public release.

trans-unit.source: Intune Groups transitioning to Azure Active Directory Groups beginning in September 2016
trans-unit.target: Intune Groups transitioning to Azure Active Directory Groups beginning in September 2016

trans-unit.source: Intune is creating a new group management experience that uses Azure Active Directory (AAD) security groups as user and device groups in Intune.
trans-unit.target: Intune is creating a new group management experience that uses Azure Active Directory (AAD) security groups as user and device groups in Intune.

trans-unit.source: These groups will be used for all group management, policy deployment, and profile deployment **when we introduce the new Azure-based Intune admin portal**.
trans-unit.target: These groups will be used for all group management, policy deployment, and profile deployment **when we introduce the new Azure-based Intune admin portal**.

trans-unit.source: This new experience will keep you from having to duplicate groups between services, **allow you access to some new Azure Active Directory Premium (AADP) group features**, and provide extensibility using PowerShell and Graph.
trans-unit.target: This new experience will keep you from having to duplicate groups between services, **allow you access to some new Azure Active Directory Premium (AADP) group features**, and provide extensibility using PowerShell and Graph.

trans-unit.source: This will also unify the group management experience across enterprise mobility management.
trans-unit.target: This will also unify the group management experience across enterprise mobility management.

trans-unit.source: To enable the move to Security Groups, the experience in the **current admin console** will undergo some modifications.
trans-unit.target: To enable the move to Security Groups, the experience in the **current admin console** will undergo some modifications.

trans-unit.source: **These changes, and the use of AAD security groups, will be recorded in the Intune documentation**.
trans-unit.target: **These changes, and the use of AAD security groups, will be recorded in the Intune documentation**.

trans-unit.source: Customers who are new to Intune will see **some of the security group changes before current tenants do**.
trans-unit.target: Customers who are new to Intune will see **some of the security group changes before current tenants do**.

trans-unit.source: In addition to changes in group management, **the following functionality will be deprecated**:
trans-unit.target: In addition to changes in group management, **the following functionality will be deprecated**:

trans-unit.source: Excluding members or groups while creating a new group
trans-unit.target: Excluding members or groups while creating a new group

trans-unit.source: **Ungrouped Users** and **Ungrouped Devices** groups
trans-unit.target: **Ungrouped Users** and **Ungrouped Devices** groups

trans-unit.source: **Manage Groups** in the Service Admin role
trans-unit.target: **Manage Groups** in the Service Admin role

trans-unit.source: Custom group-based alerts for Notification Rules
trans-unit.target: Custom group-based alerts for Notification Rules

trans-unit.source: Pivoting with groups in reports
trans-unit.target: Pivoting with groups in reports

trans-unit.source: Addition of 'Notifications' to the Company Portal for Android
trans-unit.target: Addition of 'Notifications' to the Company Portal for Android

trans-unit.source: We are releasing an update to the Company Portal for Android in September that will introduce a new **Notifications** icon on the homepage.
trans-unit.target: We are releasing an update to the Company Portal for Android in September that will introduce a new **Notifications** icon on the homepage.

trans-unit.source: Tapping this icon will access the **Notifications** page that will show your end user all the items that require attention in the Company Portal app such as device non-compliance, enrollment update, and enrollment activation.
trans-unit.target: Tapping this icon will access the **Notifications** page that will show your end user all the items that require attention in the Company Portal app such as device non-compliance, enrollment update, and enrollment activation.

trans-unit.source: If you also use the iOS Company Portal app, you’ll already see the notifications experience.
trans-unit.target: If you also use the iOS Company Portal app, you’ll already see the notifications experience.

trans-unit.source: With the introduction of the **Notifications** page, you will not see the **Company Access Setup** page every time you launch or resume the Company Portal for Android as long as the device is already enrolled.
trans-unit.target: With the introduction of the **Notifications** page, you will not see the **Company Access Setup** page every time you launch or resume the Company Portal for Android as long as the device is already enrolled.

trans-unit.source: We hear many of you have created end-user guidance and appreciate advanced notice when your guidance/screen shots may need updating.
trans-unit.target: We hear many of you have created end-user guidance and appreciate advanced notice when your guidance/screen shots may need updating.

trans-unit.source: Please update your documentation to reflect the upcoming change in experience.
trans-unit.target: Please update your documentation to reflect the upcoming change in experience.

trans-unit.source: Find updated screenshots here: https://aka.ms/androidcpupdate.
trans-unit.target: Find updated screenshots here: https://aka.ms/androidcpupdate.

trans-unit.source: Improvements in how iOS end users get their apps
trans-unit.target: Improvements in how iOS end users get their apps

trans-unit.source: The following changes are being made in September to the apps tiles in the Company Portal app for iOS to point users to different views in a single location, the Company Portal website, for all of their apps.
trans-unit.target: The following changes are being made in September to the apps tiles in the Company Portal app for iOS to point users to different views in a single location, the Company Portal website, for all of their apps.

trans-unit.source: Currently, Apple restrictions prohibit line-of-business and managed app store apps from being listed in the Company Portal app, and require users to visit different views to find all of their apps.
trans-unit.target: Currently, Apple restrictions prohibit line-of-business and managed app store apps from being listed in the Company Portal app, and require users to visit different views to find all of their apps.

trans-unit.source: The **Company Apps** tile currently points to a list of all apps in the ALL tab of the Company Portal website, and it will continue to work the same way.
trans-unit.target: The **Company Apps** tile currently points to a list of all apps in the ALL tab of the Company Portal website, and it will continue to work the same way.

trans-unit.source: The tile name will change to **All Apps**.
trans-unit.target: The tile name will change to **All Apps**.

trans-unit.source: The **Other Apps** tile currently points to a view, inside the Company Portal app, that lists all apps that Apple permits the Company Portal app to show.
trans-unit.target: The **Other Apps** tile currently points to a view, inside the Company Portal app, that lists all apps that Apple permits the Company Portal app to show.

trans-unit.source: The tile name will change to **Featured Apps**, and tapping the tile will take users to the FEATURED tab of the Company Portal website.
trans-unit.target: The tile name will change to **Featured Apps**, and tapping the tile will take users to the FEATURED tab of the Company Portal website.

trans-unit.source: The **Categories** tile currently points to a view, inside the Company Portal app, that lists categories of apps.
trans-unit.target: The **Categories** tile currently points to a view, inside the Company Portal app, that lists categories of apps.

trans-unit.source: The tile name will not change, but it will now point to the CATEGORIES tab of the Company Portal website.
trans-unit.target: The tile name will not change, but it will now point to the CATEGORIES tab of the Company Portal website.

trans-unit.source: You can find updated screenshots [here](https://gallery.technet.microsoft.com/Improvements-in-how-iOS-d1104186).
trans-unit.target: You can find updated screenshots [here](https://gallery.technet.microsoft.com/Improvements-in-how-iOS-d1104186).

trans-unit.target: Service deprecation

trans-unit.source: Changes in support for the iOS Company Portal app
trans-unit.target: Changes in support for the iOS Company Portal app

trans-unit.source: In September, all users of the Microsoft Intune Company Portal app for iOS will be required to use its latest version.
trans-unit.target: In September, all users of the Microsoft Intune Company Portal app for iOS will be required to use its latest version.

trans-unit.source: New users will only be able to download the latest version and current users will be required to update to it.
trans-unit.target: New users will only be able to download the latest version and current users will be required to update to it.

trans-unit.source: The latest version requires iOS 8.0 or later, so devices running older iOS versions won’t be able to use the Company Portal or enroll until they update their device to iOS 8.0 or later and then update the Company Portal app to the latest version.
trans-unit.target: The latest version requires iOS 8.0 or later, so devices running older iOS versions won’t be able to use the Company Portal or enroll until they update their device to iOS 8.0 or later and then update the Company Portal app to the latest version.

trans-unit.source: Enrolled devices running versions below iOS 8.0 will continue to be managed and listed in the Intune Admin Console.
trans-unit.target: Enrolled devices running versions below iOS 8.0 will continue to be managed and listed in the Intune Admin Console.

trans-unit.source: Minimum iOS Managed Browser version updated to 8.0
trans-unit.target: Minimum iOS Managed Browser version updated to 8.0

trans-unit.source: In August, Intune will release an updated Microsoft Intune Managed Browser app for iOS that will only support devices running iOS 8.0 or later.
trans-unit.target: In August, Intune will release an updated Microsoft Intune Managed Browser app for iOS that will only support devices running iOS 8.0 or later.

trans-unit.source: While iOS 7.1 devices will still be able to use the existing Managed Browser app, please encourage your users to update to iOS 8.0 or later to access and take full advantage of new Managed Browser features.
trans-unit.target: While iOS 7.1 devices will still be able to use the existing Managed Browser app, please encourage your users to update to iOS 8.0 or later to access and take full advantage of new Managed Browser features.

trans-unit.source: Company Portal apps for Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 are being deprecated
trans-unit.target: Company Portal apps for Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 are being deprecated

trans-unit.source: Starting in October 2016, Microsoft Intune will deprecate support for Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 Company Portal apps.
trans-unit.target: Starting in October 2016, Microsoft Intune will deprecate support for Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 Company Portal apps.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Intune will also deprecate support for the Windows Phone 8 platform.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Intune will also deprecate support for the Windows Phone 8 platform.

trans-unit.source: As a consequence, you will not be able to enroll or update any Windows Phone 8 devices.
trans-unit.target: As a consequence, you will not be able to enroll or update any Windows Phone 8 devices.

trans-unit.source: You can continue to manage Windows Phone 8 and Windows 8 devices that are already enrolled.
trans-unit.target: You can continue to manage Windows Phone 8 and Windows 8 devices that are already enrolled.

trans-unit.source: Update Windows Phone 8 and Windows 8 devices to Windows 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1, and use the corresponding Windows 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1 Company Portal apps to continue distributing apps to these devices without disruptions.
trans-unit.target: Update Windows Phone 8 and Windows 8 devices to Windows 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1, and use the corresponding Windows 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1 Company Portal apps to continue distributing apps to these devices without disruptions.

trans-unit.source: July 2016
trans-unit.target: July 2016

trans-unit.source: App management
trans-unit.target: App management

trans-unit.source: Improve the app provisioning profile update experience
trans-unit.target: Improve the app provisioning profile update experience

trans-unit.source: Apple iOS line of business mobile apps are built with a provisioning profile included and code signed with a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Apple iOS line of business mobile apps are built with a provisioning profile included and code signed with a certificate.

trans-unit.source: When the app runs on an iOS device, iOS confirms the integrity of the iOS app and enforces policies defined by the provisioning profile.
trans-unit.target: When the app runs on an iOS device, iOS confirms the integrity of the iOS app and enforces policies defined by the provisioning profile.

trans-unit.source: The enterprise signing certificate you use to sign apps typically lasts for 3 years.
trans-unit.target: The enterprise signing certificate you use to sign apps typically lasts for 3 years.

trans-unit.source: However, the provisioning profile expires after 1 year.
trans-unit.target: However, the provisioning profile expires after 1 year.

trans-unit.source: With this update, Intune gives you the tools to proactively deploy a new provisioning profile policy to devices that have apps that are near expiry while the certificate is still valid.
trans-unit.target: With this update, Intune gives you the tools to proactively deploy a new provisioning profile policy to devices that have apps that are near expiry while the certificate is still valid.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Use iOS mobile provisioning profile policies to keep your line of business apps up to date](/intune/deploy-use/ios-mobile-app-provisioning-profiles).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Use iOS mobile provisioning profile policies to keep your line of business apps up to date](/intune/deploy-use/ios-mobile-app-provisioning-profiles).

trans-unit.source: Xamarin SDK for Intune apps is available
trans-unit.target: Xamarin SDK for Intune apps is available

trans-unit.source: The Intune App SDK Xamarin component allows you to enable the Intune mobile app management features in your mobile iOS and Android apps built with Xamarin.
trans-unit.target: The Intune App SDK Xamarin component allows you to enable the Intune mobile app management features in your mobile iOS and Android apps built with Xamarin.

trans-unit.source: You can find the component in the [Xamarin store](https://components.xamarin.com/view/Microsoft.Intune.MAM) or on the [Microsoft Intune Github page](https://github.com/msintuneappsdk).
trans-unit.target: You can find the component in the [Xamarin store](https://components.xamarin.com/view/Microsoft.Intune.MAM) or on the [Microsoft Intune Github page](https://github.com/msintuneappsdk).

trans-unit.source: Device management
trans-unit.target: Device management

trans-unit.source: Increased device enrollment limits
trans-unit.target: Increased device enrollment limits

trans-unit.source: Intune increased the maximum configurable device enrollment limit from 5 to 15 devices per user.
trans-unit.target: Intune increased the maximum configurable device enrollment limit from 5 to 15 devices per user.

trans-unit.source: TeamViewer Integration for Windows PCs running the Intune client software
trans-unit.target: TeamViewer Integration for Windows PCs running the Intune client software

trans-unit.source: [TeamViewer](https://www.teamviewer.com) integration for Windows PCs that run the Intune client lets you establish remote assistance sessions with Windows PCs to help support end-user helpdesk departments.
trans-unit.target: [TeamViewer](https://www.teamviewer.com) integration for Windows PCs that run the Intune client lets you establish remote assistance sessions with Windows PCs to help support end-user helpdesk departments.

trans-unit.source: This includes Windows 7, 8, 8.1 and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: This includes Windows 7, 8, 8.1 and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client](common-windows-pc-management-tasks-with-the-microsoft-intune-computer-client.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client](common-windows-pc-management-tasks-with-the-microsoft-intune-computer-client.md).

trans-unit.source: Company Portal updates
trans-unit.target: Company Portal updates

trans-unit.source: Company Portal website
trans-unit.target: Company Portal website

trans-unit.source: Improved end-user experience when enrolling Windows devices
trans-unit.target: Improved end-user experience when enrolling Windows devices

trans-unit.source: When you are using conditional access, the enrollment steps for Windows 8.1, Windows 10 Desktop, and Windows 10 Mobile have been clarified in the Company Portal website.
trans-unit.target: When you are using conditional access, the enrollment steps for Windows 8.1, Windows 10 Desktop, and Windows 10 Mobile have been clarified in the Company Portal website.

trans-unit.source: Users will now see separate “Device enrollment” and “Workplace Join” steps, making it easier for them to see the status of their device and to complete the process if they experience a Workplace Join (WPJ) failure.
trans-unit.target: Users will now see separate “Device enrollment” and “Workplace Join” steps, making it easier for them to see the status of their device and to complete the process if they experience a Workplace Join (WPJ) failure.

trans-unit.source: The separate steps are also expected to simplify the troubleshooting process for IT administrators.
trans-unit.target: The separate steps are also expected to simplify the troubleshooting process for IT administrators.

trans-unit.source: Previously, when end users tried to enroll and all enrollment steps succeeded except for WPJ, the enrolled device would not appear on the list of devices for users to identify, causing confusion for users.
trans-unit.target: Previously, when end users tried to enroll and all enrollment steps succeeded except for WPJ, the enrolled device would not appear on the list of devices for users to identify, causing confusion for users.

trans-unit.source: Android
trans-unit.target: Android

trans-unit.source: Android Company Portal app
trans-unit.target: Android Company Portal app

trans-unit.source: If Android end users see an error message that says their device is missing a required certificate, they can tap a "How to resolve this" button to get [steps](/intune/enduser/your-device-is-missing-a-required-certificate-android#your-device-is-missing-a-certificate-required-by-your-it-administrator) for installing the missing certificate.
trans-unit.target: If Android end users see an error message that says their device is missing a required certificate, they can tap a "How to resolve this" button to get [steps](/intune/enduser/your-device-is-missing-a-required-certificate-android#your-device-is-missing-a-certificate-required-by-your-it-administrator) for installing the missing certificate.

trans-unit.source: If users complete the steps, but see an additional "missing certificate" error message, they are asked to contact their IT administrator and provide this [link](/intune/troubleshoot/troubleshoot-device-enrollment-in-intune#android-certificate-issues), which contains steps that IT administrators can use to fix the certificate issue.
trans-unit.target: If users complete the steps, but see an additional "missing certificate" error message, they are asked to contact their IT administrator and provide this [link](/intune/troubleshoot/troubleshoot-device-enrollment-in-intune#android-certificate-issues), which contains steps that IT administrators can use to fix the certificate issue.

trans-unit.source: Restrict side-loaded app installations to enrolled devices
trans-unit.target: Restrict side-loaded app installations to enrolled devices

trans-unit.source: Android devices can no longer install applications through the Company Portal website unless the devices have been enrolled in Intune by using the Intune Company Portal app for Android.
trans-unit.target: Android devices can no longer install applications through the Company Portal website unless the devices have been enrolled in Intune by using the Intune Company Portal app for Android.

trans-unit.source: iOS
trans-unit.target: iOS

trans-unit.source: Changes to Device Enrollment Managers accounts in the iOS Company Portal app
trans-unit.target: Changes to Device Enrollment Managers accounts in the iOS Company Portal app

trans-unit.source: To improve performance and scale, Intune no longer displays all Device Enrollment Managers (DEM) devices in the **My Devices** pane of the iOS Company Portal app.
trans-unit.target: To improve performance and scale, Intune no longer displays all Device Enrollment Managers (DEM) devices in the **My Devices** pane of the iOS Company Portal app.

trans-unit.source: Only the local device running the app is displayed, and only if it is enrolled via the Company Portal app.
trans-unit.target: Only the local device running the app is displayed, and only if it is enrolled via the Company Portal app.

trans-unit.source: The DEM user may perform actions on the local device, but remote management of other enrolled devices can only be performed from the Intune admin console.
trans-unit.target: The DEM user may perform actions on the local device, but remote management of other enrolled devices can only be performed from the Intune admin console.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, Intune is deprecating use of DEM accounts with either the Apple Device Enrollment Program or the Apple Configurator tool.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, Intune is deprecating use of DEM accounts with either the Apple Device Enrollment Program or the Apple Configurator tool.

trans-unit.source: Both these enrollment methods already support user-less enrollment for shared iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: Both these enrollment methods already support user-less enrollment for shared iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: Only use DEM accounts when user-less enrollment for shared devices is unavailable.
trans-unit.target: Only use DEM accounts when user-less enrollment for shared devices is unavailable.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Enroll corporate-owned devices with the Device Enrollment Manager in Microsoft Intune](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/deploy-use/enroll-corporate-owned-devices-with-the-device-enrollment-manager-in-microsoft-intune).

trans-unit.target: Device management

trans-unit.source: Windows Defender policy setting to protect against potentially unwanted apps.
trans-unit.target: Windows Defender policy setting to protect against potentially unwanted apps.

trans-unit.source: A new Windows Defender setting named **Potentially Unwanted Application Detection** has been added to the general configuration policy for Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile.
trans-unit.target: A new Windows Defender setting named **Potentially Unwanted Application Detection** has been added to the general configuration policy for Windows 10 Desktop and Mobile.

trans-unit.source: You can use this setting to protect enrolled Windows desktop computers against running software classed by Windows Defender as potentially unwanted.
trans-unit.target: You can use this setting to protect enrolled Windows desktop computers against running software classed by Windows Defender as potentially unwanted.

trans-unit.source: You can protect against these applications running, or use audit mode to report when a potentially unwanted application is installed.
trans-unit.target: You can protect against these applications running, or use audit mode to report when a potentially unwanted application is installed.

trans-unit.source: See [Windows 10 policy settings in Microsoft Intune](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/deploy-use/windows-10-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Windows 10 policy settings in Microsoft Intune](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/deploy-use/windows-10-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Conditional access
trans-unit.target: Conditional access

trans-unit.source: Cisco ISE network access control policy for Intune.
trans-unit.target: Cisco ISE network access control policy for Intune.

trans-unit.source: Customers who use the Cisco Identity Service Engine (ISE) 2.1 and also use Microsoft Intune can set a network access control policy in ISE.
trans-unit.target: Customers who use the Cisco Identity Service Engine (ISE) 2.1 and also use Microsoft Intune can set a network access control policy in ISE.

trans-unit.source: Using this policy, devices that need to connect to the network using WiFi or VPN must meet following conditions before they are allowed access:
trans-unit.target: Using this policy, devices that need to connect to the network using WiFi or VPN must meet following conditions before they are allowed access:

trans-unit.source: Must be managed by Intune
trans-unit.target: Must be managed by Intune

trans-unit.source: Must be compliant with any deployed Intune compliance policies
trans-unit.target: Must be compliant with any deployed Intune compliance policies

trans-unit.source: End users of noncompliant devices will be prompted to enroll, and remediate any compliance issues to gain access.
trans-unit.target: End users of noncompliant devices will be prompted to enroll, and remediate any compliance issues to gain access.

trans-unit.source: Conditional access for browser.
trans-unit.target: Conditional access for browser.

trans-unit.source: You can set a conditional access policy for [Exchange Online](restrict-access-to-exchange-online-with-microsoft-intune.md) and [SharePoint Online](restrict-access-to-sharepoint-online-with-microsoft-intune.md) so that they can only be accessed from supported web browsers on managed and compliant iOS and Android devices.
trans-unit.target: You can set a conditional access policy for [Exchange Online](restrict-access-to-exchange-online-with-microsoft-intune.md) and [SharePoint Online](restrict-access-to-sharepoint-online-with-microsoft-intune.md) so that they can only be accessed from supported web browsers on managed and compliant iOS and Android devices.

trans-unit.source: End users who try to sign in to Outlook Web Access (OWA) and SharePoint sites with iOS and Android devices will be prompted to enroll their device with Intune as well as to fix any non-compliance issues before they can complete sign-in.
trans-unit.target: End users who try to sign in to Outlook Web Access (OWA) and SharePoint sites with iOS and Android devices will be prompted to enroll their device with Intune as well as to fix any non-compliance issues before they can complete sign-in.

trans-unit.source: Dynamics CRM Online supports conditional access.
trans-unit.target: Dynamics CRM Online supports conditional access.

trans-unit.source: You can set a conditional access policy for [Dynamics CRM Online](restrict-access-to-dynamics-crm-online-with-microsoft-intune.md) so that it can only be accessed by managed and compliant iOS and Android devices.
trans-unit.target: You can set a conditional access policy for [Dynamics CRM Online](restrict-access-to-dynamics-crm-online-with-microsoft-intune.md) so that it can only be accessed by managed and compliant iOS and Android devices.

trans-unit.source: End users who try to sign in to the Dynamics CRM mobile app on iOS and Android will be prompted to enroll with Intune as well as remediate any non-compliance issues before sign-in can complete.
trans-unit.target: End users who try to sign in to the Dynamics CRM mobile app on iOS and Android will be prompted to enroll with Intune as well as remediate any non-compliance issues before sign-in can complete.

trans-unit.source: E Company Portal updates
trans-unit.target: E Company Portal updates

trans-unit.source: Android Company Portal app
trans-unit.target: Android Company Portal app

trans-unit.source: When IT administrators apply the new "Require that devices disallow installation of apps from unknown sources (Android 4.0+)" policy, end users with Android 4.0 or later devices will see the message, "Installation from Unknown sources must be disabled."
trans-unit.target: When IT administrators apply the new "Require that devices disallow installation of apps from unknown sources (Android 4.0+)" policy, end users with Android 4.0 or later devices will see the message, "Installation from Unknown sources must be disabled."

trans-unit.source: Users will need to go to **Settings** > **Security**, and turn off **Unknown sources**.
trans-unit.target: Users will need to go to **Settings** > **Security**, and turn off **Unknown sources**.

trans-unit.source: A link in the compliance message lets users get more [information](/Intune/EndUser/you-are-asked-to-turn-off-unknown-sources-android) about the message and why they are being required to turn off the setting.
trans-unit.target: A link in the compliance message lets users get more [information](/Intune/EndUser/you-are-asked-to-turn-off-unknown-sources-android) about the message and why they are being required to turn off the setting.

trans-unit.source: When IT administrators apply the new "Require that devices have enabled scanning of apps for security threats (Android 4.0+)" policy, end users with Android 4.0 or later devices will see the message, "Scan device for security threats."
trans-unit.target: When IT administrators apply the new "Require that devices have enabled scanning of apps for security threats (Android 4.0+)" policy, end users with Android 4.0 or later devices will see the message, "Scan device for security threats."

trans-unit.source: Users will need to go to **Settings** > **Google** > **Security**, and turn on **Scan device for security threats**.
trans-unit.target: Users will need to go to **Settings** > **Google** > **Security**, and turn on **Scan device for security threats**.

trans-unit.source: A link in the compliance message lets users get more [information](/Intune/EndUser/you-are-asked-to-turn-on-scan-device-for-security-threats-android) about the message and why they are being required to turn on the setting.
trans-unit.target: A link in the compliance message lets users get more [information](/Intune/EndUser/you-are-asked-to-turn-on-scan-device-for-security-threats-android) about the message and why they are being required to turn on the setting.

trans-unit.source: When IT administrators apply the new "Require that USB debugging is disabled (Android 4.2+)" policy, end users with Android 4.2 or later devices will see the message, "USB debugging must be disabled."
trans-unit.target: When IT administrators apply the new "Require that USB debugging is disabled (Android 4.2+)" policy, end users with Android 4.2 or later devices will see the message, "USB debugging must be disabled."

trans-unit.source: Users will need to go to **Settings** > **Developer options**, and turn off **USB debugging**."
trans-unit.target: Users will need to go to **Settings** > **Developer options**, and turn off **USB debugging**."

trans-unit.source: A link in the compliance message lets users get more [information](/Intune/EndUser/you-are-asked-to-turn-off-usb-debugging-android) about the message and why they are being required to turn off the setting.
trans-unit.target: A link in the compliance message lets users get more [information](/Intune/EndUser/you-are-asked-to-turn-off-usb-debugging-android) about the message and why they are being required to turn off the setting.

trans-unit.source: When IT administrators apply the new "Minimum Android security patch level (Android 6.0+)" policy, end users with Android 6.0 or later devices will see the message, "This device does not meet the minimum Android security patch level."
trans-unit.target: When IT administrators apply the new "Minimum Android security patch level (Android 6.0+)" policy, end users with Android 6.0 or later devices will see the message, "This device does not meet the minimum Android security patch level."

trans-unit.source: Users will need to install the required security patch.
trans-unit.target: Users will need to install the required security patch.

trans-unit.source: A link in the compliance message lets users get [information](/Intune/EndUser/you-are-asked-to-turn-on-scan-device-for-security-threats-android) about how to install the required security patch and to see which security patch they currently have installed.
trans-unit.target: A link in the compliance message lets users get [information](/Intune/EndUser/you-are-asked-to-turn-on-scan-device-for-security-threats-android) about how to install the required security patch and to see which security patch they currently have installed.

trans-unit.target: iOS Company Portal app

trans-unit.source: When end users are installing line-of-business apps, they will now see an improved app installation experience.
trans-unit.target: When end users are installing line-of-business apps, they will now see an improved app installation experience.

trans-unit.source: If the app installation is taking a long time, users can manually sync their device to force the sync process to resume.
trans-unit.target: If the app installation is taking a long time, users can manually sync their device to force the sync process to resume.

trans-unit.source: To review the end-user instructions, see [Sync your iOS device manually](/Intune/EndUser/sync-your-device-manually-ios).
trans-unit.target: To review the end-user instructions, see [Sync your iOS device manually](/Intune/EndUser/sync-your-device-manually-ios).

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Intune Company Portal app for iOS has been updated to support iOS version 8.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Intune Company Portal app for iOS has been updated to support iOS version 8.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: This update means that end users can install the Company Portal app and enroll new devices in Intune only if the device is running iOS version 8.0 or later.
trans-unit.target: This update means that end users can install the Company Portal app and enroll new devices in Intune only if the device is running iOS version 8.0 or later.

trans-unit.source: Users who have already enrolled devices that are running on an unsupported version of iOS can continue to use the Company Portal app that is on their device.
trans-unit.target: Users who have already enrolled devices that are running on an unsupported version of iOS can continue to use the Company Portal app that is on their device.

trans-unit.target: **End user toast notifications**: End users will now see toast notifications from the Android Company Portal app when they are enrolling their devices or removing their devices from the Company Portal.

trans-unit.source: What's coming
trans-unit.target: What's coming

trans-unit.source: **Message center UI onboarding**.
trans-unit.target: **Message center UI onboarding**.

trans-unit.source: As part of the migration of Intune into the [Office 365 Management portal](https://portal.office.com/), we will begin taking advantage of their Message Center to communicate new features and other notifications.
trans-unit.target: As part of the migration of Intune into the [Office 365 Management portal](https://portal.office.com/), we will begin taking advantage of their Message Center to communicate new features and other notifications.

trans-unit.source: Also, by installing the companion Office 365 Admin mobile app, you can receive notifications on your mobile phone and easily forward any messages to users or a distribution alias.
trans-unit.target: Also, by installing the companion Office 365 Admin mobile app, you can receive notifications on your mobile phone and easily forward any messages to users or a distribution alias.

trans-unit.source: We will begin using the Message Center with our May release to notify you when updates are completed and will include information on new and improved Intune features.
trans-unit.target: We will begin using the Message Center with our May release to notify you when updates are completed and will include information on new and improved Intune features.

trans-unit.source: Check out the Message Center today by logging into the [Office 365 Management portal](https://portal.office.com/) and choosing the MESSAGE CENTER option in the left navigation pane.
trans-unit.target: Check out the Message Center today by logging into the [Office 365 Management portal](https://portal.office.com/) and choosing the MESSAGE CENTER option in the left navigation pane.

trans-unit.source: **Changes to Device Enrollment Managers accounts**.
trans-unit.target: **Changes to Device Enrollment Managers accounts**.

trans-unit.source: To improve performance and scale, Intune is no longer showing **all** Device Enrollment Managers (DEM) devices in the **My Devices** pane of the iOS Company Portal app.
trans-unit.target: To improve performance and scale, Intune is no longer showing **all** Device Enrollment Managers (DEM) devices in the **My Devices** pane of the iOS Company Portal app.

trans-unit.source: Only the local device running the app is displayed, and only if it is enrolled via the Company Portal app.
trans-unit.target: Only the local device running the app is displayed, and only if it is enrolled via the Company Portal app.

trans-unit.source: The DEM user may perform actions on the local device, but remote management of other enrolled devices can only be performed from the Intune admin console.
trans-unit.target: The DEM user may perform actions on the local device, but remote management of other enrolled devices can only be performed from the Intune admin console.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, Intune is deprecating use of DEM accounts with either the Apple Device Enrollment Program or the Apple Configurator tool.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, Intune is deprecating use of DEM accounts with either the Apple Device Enrollment Program or the Apple Configurator tool.

trans-unit.source: Both these enrollment methods already support user-less enrollment for shared iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: Both these enrollment methods already support user-less enrollment for shared iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: Only use DEM accounts when user-less enrollment for shared devices is unavailable.
trans-unit.target: Only use DEM accounts when user-less enrollment for shared devices is unavailable.

trans-unit.target: Service deprecation

trans-unit.source: Intune Viewer apps.
trans-unit.target: Intune Viewer apps.

trans-unit.source: With the release of the new RMS sharing app, we are removing the following Intune Viewer apps, beginning August, 2016:
trans-unit.target: With the release of the new RMS sharing app, we are removing the following Intune Viewer apps, beginning August, 2016:

trans-unit.source: Intune AV Viewer
trans-unit.target: Intune AV Viewer

trans-unit.source: Intune PDF Viewer
trans-unit.target: Intune PDF Viewer

trans-unit.source: Intune Image Viewer for Android from Google Play
trans-unit.target: Intune Image Viewer for Android from Google Play

trans-unit.source: Instead of using the Intune Viewer apps, we recommend using the new Rights Management app (RMS sharing) for Android, which allows you to deploy one app instead of three separate apps to securely view corporate files on Android devices.
trans-unit.target: Instead of using the Intune Viewer apps, we recommend using the new Rights Management app (RMS sharing) for Android, which allows you to deploy one app instead of three separate apps to securely view corporate files on Android devices.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about the RMS sharing app (with link to documentation).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about the RMS sharing app (with link to documentation).

trans-unit.source: Custom Group Targeting of Notification Rules Removal.
trans-unit.target: Custom Group Targeting of Notification Rules Removal.

trans-unit.source: Intune notification rules define who an email alert will be sent to from Intune.
trans-unit.target: Intune notification rules define who an email alert will be sent to from Intune.

trans-unit.source: Currently, you can configure notification rules to send emails to all users of devices in an Intune device group that you created.
trans-unit.target: Currently, you can configure notification rules to send emails to all users of devices in an Intune device group that you created.

trans-unit.source: From around June 1st 2016 moving forward, targeting user-created groups will no longer be supported.
trans-unit.target: From around June 1st 2016 moving forward, targeting user-created groups will no longer be supported.

trans-unit.source: Today, to target a notification rule to a group you created from the Microsoft Intune administration console, you would take the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Today, to target a notification rule to a group you created from the Microsoft Intune administration console, you would take the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the **Admin** workspace, click **Notification Rules** > **Create New Rule**
trans-unit.target: In the **Admin** workspace, click **Notification Rules** > **Create New Rule**

trans-unit.source: In step two of the Create Notification Rule Wizard, select the device groups which the rule will target.
trans-unit.target: In step two of the Create Notification Rule Wizard, select the device groups which the rule will target.

trans-unit.source: This step, “select device groups”, is being removed from the Intune Console.
trans-unit.target: This step, “select device groups”, is being removed from the Intune Console.

trans-unit.source: The preliminary timeline for this change is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The preliminary timeline for this change is as follows:

trans-unit.source: In June, 2016, new tenants will not see step two of the Create Notification Rule Wizard.
trans-unit.target: In June, 2016, new tenants will not see step two of the Create Notification Rule Wizard.

trans-unit.source: Exiting tenants are unaffected.
trans-unit.target: Exiting tenants are unaffected.

trans-unit.source: Around August, 2016, some existing tenants will not see the “select device groups” in the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Around August, 2016, some existing tenants will not see the “select device groups” in the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Around October, 2016, we expect that all tenants will not see the “select device groups” in the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Around October, 2016, we expect that all tenants will not see the “select device groups” in the wizard.

trans-unit.source: **Changes in support for the iOS Company Portal app**.
trans-unit.target: **Changes in support for the iOS Company Portal app**.

trans-unit.source: In the coming months, there will be an update for the Microsoft Intune Company Portal app for iOS that will only support devices running iOS 8.0 or later.
trans-unit.target: In the coming months, there will be an update for the Microsoft Intune Company Portal app for iOS that will only support devices running iOS 8.0 or later.

trans-unit.source: Users won’t be able to enroll new devices running versions below iOS 8.0.
trans-unit.target: Users won’t be able to enroll new devices running versions below iOS 8.0.

trans-unit.source: Enrolled devices running versions below iOS 8.0 will continue to be managed and will, for a limited time, be able to continue using the Company Portal app.
trans-unit.target: Enrolled devices running versions below iOS 8.0 will continue to be managed and will, for a limited time, be able to continue using the Company Portal app.

trans-unit.source: However, devices must be on iOS 8.0 or later to access the latest versions of the Company Portal app.
trans-unit.target: However, devices must be on iOS 8.0 or later to access the latest versions of the Company Portal app.

trans-unit.source: We encourage you to notify users to update to iOS 8.0 or later to take full advantage of new Intune features.
trans-unit.target: We encourage you to notify users to update to iOS 8.0 or later to take full advantage of new Intune features.

trans-unit.source: **Checked in**: Indicates the policy was deployed to the user, and app was used in work context, and successfully received the policy.
trans-unit.target: **Checked in**: Indicates the policy was deployed to the user, and app was used in work context, and successfully received the policy.

trans-unit.source: **Not checked in**: Indicates the policy was deployed to the user, but app has not been used in the work context since then.

trans-unit.source: MAM controls to prevent Outlook contacts sync (Android).
trans-unit.target: MAM controls to prevent Outlook contacts sync (Android).

trans-unit.source: A new setting is available for [mobile application management](create-and-deploy-mobile-app-management-policies-with-microsoft-intune.md) without device enrollment.
trans-unit.target: A new setting is available for [mobile application management](create-and-deploy-mobile-app-management-policies-with-microsoft-intune.md) without device enrollment.

trans-unit.source: This setting allows you to prevent an application from syncing contacts to the native address book on Android devices.
trans-unit.target: This setting allows you to prevent an application from syncing contacts to the native address book on Android devices.

trans-unit.source: When this setting is enabled, targeted applications will no longer be able to save contacts to the native address book.
trans-unit.target: When this setting is enabled, targeted applications will no longer be able to save contacts to the native address book.

trans-unit.source: When this setting is disabled, targeted applications will be able to save contacts to the native address book.
trans-unit.target: When this setting is disabled, targeted applications will be able to save contacts to the native address book.

trans-unit.source: When you [remotely wipe a device or app](wipe-managed-company-app-data-with-Microsoft-Intune.md), contacts that have already been saved to the native address book will be removed.
trans-unit.target: When you [remotely wipe a device or app](wipe-managed-company-app-data-with-Microsoft-Intune.md), contacts that have already been saved to the native address book will be removed.

trans-unit.source: This new setting is supported initially by the Outlook application on Android devices.
trans-unit.target: This new setting is supported initially by the Outlook application on Android devices.

trans-unit.target: Device management

trans-unit.source: Phone number identification for corporate-owned devices.
trans-unit.target: Phone number identification for corporate-owned devices.

trans-unit.source: Phones that are categorized as "Corporate" are now identified with their full phone number when, for example, you run a mobile device inventory report.
trans-unit.target: Phones that are categorized as "Corporate" are now identified with their full phone number when, for example, you run a mobile device inventory report.

trans-unit.source: BYOD phone numbers continue to be masked with ****, with only the last 4 digits displayed.
trans-unit.target: BYOD phone numbers continue to be masked with ****, with only the last 4 digits displayed.

trans-unit.source: Company portal updates
trans-unit.target: Company portal updates

trans-unit.source: **Android Company portal app** Users who have not enrolled their device in Intune and who do not have the correct certificate installed will not be able to sign in to the Android Company Portal app and will see the message, “You cannot sign in because your device is missing a required certificate.”
trans-unit.target: **Android Company portal app** Users who have not enrolled their device in Intune and who do not have the correct certificate installed will not be able to sign in to the Android Company Portal app and will see the message, “You cannot sign in because your device is missing a required certificate.”

trans-unit.source: The message includes a “How to resolve this” link that users can tap to see instructions for installing the certificate.
trans-unit.target: The message includes a “How to resolve this” link that users can tap to see instructions for installing the certificate.

trans-unit.source: To see the steps that end users follow to resolve the issue, see [Your device is missing a required certificate](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt502762.aspx#BKMK_andr_cert_missing).
trans-unit.target: To see the steps that end users follow to resolve the issue, see [Your device is missing a required certificate](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt502762.aspx#BKMK_andr_cert_missing).

trans-unit.source: **iOS Company Portal app** Support has been added for the pull-to-refresh action to refresh the content on the home screen, which includes listed apps, listed devices, and IT contact information.
trans-unit.target: **iOS Company Portal app** Support has been added for the pull-to-refresh action to refresh the content on the home screen, which includes listed apps, listed devices, and IT contact information.

trans-unit.source: The pull-to-refresh action does not check compliance or policy information, which can be done by selecting the tile for your current device and tapping the **Sync** button.
trans-unit.target: The pull-to-refresh action does not check compliance or policy information, which can be done by selecting the tile for your current device and tapping the **Sync** button.

trans-unit.source: **Windows 10 Mobile and Windows Phone 8.1 Company Portal app** When end users are installing line-of-business apps, they will now see an improved app installation experience.
trans-unit.target: **Windows 10 Mobile and Windows Phone 8.1 Company Portal app** When end users are installing line-of-business apps, they will now see an improved app installation experience.

trans-unit.source: If the app installation is taking a long time, users can manually sync their device to force the sync process to resume.
trans-unit.target: If the app installation is taking a long time, users can manually sync their device to force the sync process to resume.

trans-unit.source: To review the end-user instructions, see [Sync your device manually to speed up app installations](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt427782.aspx#BKMK_win10m_wp81_sync_manually).
trans-unit.target: To review the end-user instructions, see [Sync your device manually to speed up app installations](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt427782.aspx#BKMK_win10m_wp81_sync_manually).

trans-unit.source: **Company Portal website** When Windows 10 Mobile and Windows Phone 8.1 users are installing line-of-business apps, they will now see the following new statuses, which provide them with more detail about the status of their installation:
trans-unit.target: **Company Portal website** When Windows 10 Mobile and Windows Phone 8.1 users are installing line-of-business apps, they will now see the following new statuses, which provide them with more detail about the status of their installation:

trans-unit.source: **Waiting for device to sync** – the user has tapped “Install” and the device now tries to sync with the Intune infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: **Waiting for device to sync** – the user has tapped “Install” and the device now tries to sync with the Intune infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: The sync is required before the installation can complete.
trans-unit.target: The sync is required before the installation can complete.

trans-unit.source: The "Waiting for device to sync" message is also a link that users can tap to see [instructions](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt590895.aspx#BKMK_iwp_sync_manually) on how to manually sync their device with Intune if the sync process is taking a long time or gets stalled.
trans-unit.target: The "Waiting for device to sync" message is also a link that users can tap to see [instructions](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt590895.aspx#BKMK_iwp_sync_manually) on how to manually sync their device with Intune if the sync process is taking a long time or gets stalled.

trans-unit.source: **Downloading** – the user’s download request is being processed and the device is downloading and installing the app.
trans-unit.target: **Downloading** – the user’s download request is being processed and the device is downloading and installing the app.

trans-unit.source: Before these statuses were added, users got confused if an app installation took a long time, because they saw only an “Installing” status, which might remain on the screen for hours.
trans-unit.target: Before these statuses were added, users got confused if an app installation took a long time, because they saw only an “Installing” status, which might remain on the screen for hours.

trans-unit.source: Adding the new statuses means that, instead of calling support, users can now tap the "Waiting for device to sync" link and follow the instructions to force the sync process to resume.
trans-unit.target: Adding the new statuses means that, instead of calling support, users can now tap the "Waiting for device to sync" link and follow the instructions to force the sync process to resume.

trans-unit.source: A new setting is available for mobile application management without device enrollment.
trans-unit.target: A new setting is available for mobile application management without device enrollment.

trans-unit.source: This setting allows you to prevent an application from syncing contacts to the native address book on iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: This setting allows you to prevent an application from syncing contacts to the native address book on iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: When this setting is enabled, the app will no longer be able to save contacts to the native address book.
trans-unit.target: When this setting is enabled, the app will no longer be able to save contacts to the native address book.

trans-unit.source: When this setting is disabled, the app will be able to save contacts to the native address book.
trans-unit.target: When this setting is disabled, the app will be able to save contacts to the native address book.

trans-unit.source: When you selectively wipe a device, all contacts that have already been saved to the native address book will be removed.
trans-unit.target: When you selectively wipe a device, all contacts that have already been saved to the native address book will be removed.

trans-unit.source: This new setting is supported by the Outlook application on iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: This new setting is supported by the Outlook application on iOS devices.

trans-unit.target: For more details about this and other settings, see [Create and deploy MAM policies](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn292747.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Access control
trans-unit.target: Access control

trans-unit.source: Skype for Business Online supports conditional access.
trans-unit.target: Skype for Business Online supports conditional access.

trans-unit.source: You can set a conditional access policy for Skype for Business Online so that it can only be accessed by managed and compliant iOS and Android devices.
trans-unit.target: You can set a conditional access policy for Skype for Business Online so that it can only be accessed by managed and compliant iOS and Android devices.

trans-unit.source: End users who try to sign in to the Skype for Business mobile app on iOS and Android will be prompted to enroll with Intune as well as fix any non-compliance issues before sign-in can complete.
trans-unit.target: End users who try to sign in to the Skype for Business mobile app on iOS and Android will be prompted to enroll with Intune as well as fix any non-compliance issues before sign-in can complete.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Manage access to Skype for Business Online](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/mt695297.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Manage access to Skype for Business Online](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/mt695297.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Device management
trans-unit.target: Device management

trans-unit.source: Intune support for iOS 9.3.
trans-unit.target: Intune support for iOS 9.3.

trans-unit.source: On Monday March 21st, Apple announced the availability of iOS 9.3.
trans-unit.target: On Monday March 21st, Apple announced the availability of iOS 9.3.

trans-unit.source: We have been busy working to ensure that Microsoft Intune is compatible with the latest version of Apple's mobile operating system, and [we are pleased to announce that Intune supports managing iOS 9.3 devices](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/microsoftintune/2016/03/23/microsoft-intune-provides-support-for-ios-9-3/).
trans-unit.target: We have been busy working to ensure that Microsoft Intune is compatible with the latest version of Apple's mobile operating system, and [we are pleased to announce that Intune supports managing iOS 9.3 devices](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/microsoftintune/2016/03/23/microsoft-intune-provides-support-for-ios-9-3/).

trans-unit.source: All existing Intune features currently available for managing iOS devices will continue to work seamlessly as users upgrade their devices to iOS 9.3.
trans-unit.target: All existing Intune features currently available for managing iOS devices will continue to work seamlessly as users upgrade their devices to iOS 9.3.

trans-unit.source: In addition, iOS 9.3 is also supported today for hybrid customers (Configuration Manager integrated with Intune).
trans-unit.target: In addition, iOS 9.3 is also supported today for hybrid customers (Configuration Manager integrated with Intune).

trans-unit.source: The Windows 10 general configuration policy now contains settings to manage Windows Defender on enrolled Windows 10 PC's.
trans-unit.target: The Windows 10 general configuration policy now contains settings to manage Windows Defender on enrolled Windows 10 PC's.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Windows 10 configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/mt404697.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Windows 10 configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/mt404697.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Company portal
trans-unit.target: Company portal

trans-unit.source: Windows app packages available directly from the Company Portal website.
trans-unit.target: Windows app packages available directly from the Company Portal website.

trans-unit.source: Users of Windows 8, Windows 8.1, and Windows RT PCs can now install Windows app packages (with the .appx extension) directly from the Company Portal website.
trans-unit.target: Users of Windows 8, Windows 8.1, and Windows RT PCs can now install Windows app packages (with the .appx extension) directly from the Company Portal website.

trans-unit.source: Previously, you had to deploy, or users had to install the Company Portal app on their devices to install apps.
trans-unit.target: Previously, you had to deploy, or users had to install the Company Portal app on their devices to install apps.

trans-unit.source: Users can remotely lock their device from the Company Portal website.
trans-unit.target: Users can remotely lock their device from the Company Portal website.

trans-unit.source: A new Remote Lock option has been added to the Company Portal website to enable users to remotely lock their device from the Portal if their device is lost or stolen.
trans-unit.target: A new Remote Lock option has been added to the Company Portal website to enable users to remotely lock their device from the Portal if their device is lost or stolen.

trans-unit.source: See the [end-user instructions](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt590895.aspx/?wt.mc_id=ui#BKMK_iwp_remote_lock).
trans-unit.target: See the [end-user instructions](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt590895.aspx/?wt.mc_id=ui#BKMK_iwp_remote_lock).
